divs: sighting detailsi don't really know why i feel compelled to give this account of what my family went through so long ago; but here goes.... when i was approx. 11 years old, ( i'm now 40) we were having a large family reunion at my grandparent's house "out in the country" of rural southeast missouri. there was approx. 45-50 of us outside in the heat of the summer, churning an old-time ice-cream churn. it was just starting to get a little dark out, when the kids ( including myself) noticed a very bright object in the western sky, up over the next hilltop from our location. we thought it was just the "evening star", and being kids, were oohhing and aahhing how pretty the "star" was. but the "star", although remaining stationary, kept getting brighter and brighter, until all of us knew it could not be a star. after getting intensely bright and bigger, it dimmed down again, to it's original form. then the light went out completely, and changed into a repeating light pattern. it had individual lights around it, that were going on and off in a circular\oval pattern. the object definitely had form, structure, and mass. all of us could plainly see it, and tell that it was "saucer" shaped. it slowly began, to move to our right, and then 6 more disc's "appeared" and joined up with the first object. all of the objects were "disc' or "saucer" shaped, and had rotating circular\oval lights, and were hovering around by each other, in no particular pattern. i can only estimate that the objects were probably a half mile away from us. the objects began to kind of fly together, moving to the right. just one disc would always be flying different than the rest of them, almost like "herding" the other's. i can remember all of us being absolutely petrified. the children were screaming running into the house ( me included ). the adults were scared, and some were running for cover, as well. i believe all of us thought that, for a lack of a better word, we were going to be invaded, bombed, or something. the disc's stayed outside, hovering close, for about 1 hour and finally left. we don't speak of this, and i still have nightmares.
